info.title: MailChimp
info.description: Create plugins that connect MailChimp to your CMS, your blog, your e-commerce shopping cart, and more.

get.description: Get the content (both html and text) for a campaign either as it would appear in the campaign archive or as the raw, original content.

parameters.name: cid
parameters.description: The campaign id to get content for (can be gathered using campaigns()).

parameters.name: for_archive
parameters.description: Controls whether we return the Archive version (true) or the Raw version (false), defaults to true.

parameters.name: dc
parameters.description: The portion after the dash in your API Key. e.g. "us1", "us2", "uk1", etc.

parameters.name: apikey
parameters.description: A valid API Key for your user account.

parameters.name: method
parameters.description: Is the method name from our API you are calling.

parameters.name: output
parameters.description: Output Formats for Serialized calls.

200.description: Create plugins that connect MailChimp to your CMS, your blog, your e-commerce shopping cart, and more.

get.description: Create a new draft campaign to send.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The Campaign Type to create.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: A hash of the standard options for this campaign. See options: "http://apidocs.mailchimp.com/api/1.3/campaigncreate.func.php"

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: The content for this campaign. See options: "http://apidocs.mailchimp.com/api/1.3/campaigncreate.func.php"

parameters.name: segment_opts
parameters.description: If you wish to do Segmentation with this campaign this array should contain: see campaignSegmentTest(). It's suggested that you test your options against campaignSegmentTest(). Also, "trans" campaigns do not support segmentation.

parameters.name: type_opts
parameters.description: Array for RSS, A/B Split or AutoResponder campaigns. See options: "http://apidocs.mailchimp.com/api/1.3/campaigncreate.func.php"

parameters.name: dc
parameters.description: The portion after the dash in your API Key. e.g. "us1", "us2", "uk1", etc.

parameters.name: apikey
parameters.description: A valid API Key for your user account.

parameters.name: method
parameters.description: Is the method name from our API you are calling.

parameters.name: output
parameters.description: Output Formats for Serialized calls.

get.description: Update just about any setting for a campaign that has not been sent.

parameters.name: cid
parameters.description: The Campaign Id to update.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: For items in the options array, this will be that parameter's name (subject, from_email, etc.). Additional parameters will be that option name (content, segment_opts). "type_opts" will be the name of the type - rss, auto, trans, etc.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: For items in the options array, this will be that parameter's value. For additional parameters, this is the same value passed to them.
